Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _upk_conn_handle upk_conn_handle_t
typedef void(* upk_net_callback_t)(upk_conn_handle_meta_t *handles, upk_payload_t *msg)

typedef for callback functions.

Parameters:
[in]handles- the handle list, where thisp is the handle that generated the event for the callback.
[in,out]data- used to pass data you specify to the callbacks.
[in]msg- the deserialized message.

make unix-domain socket connection.

Parameters:

void upk_read_packets ( upk_conn_handle_meta_t *  handles)

retry socket connection, pausing between each retry.

Parameters:
[in]retriesnumber of times to retry.
[in]sockpathpath to the socket to connect to (e.g. the controller socket).
Returns:
the file descriptor of the resulting connection
-2 unable to connect, check errno non-blocking read a packet off the 'wire'.

After an entire packet has been recieved, will call the appropriate callback for the packet type.

References _upk_conn_handle::fd, _upk_conn_handle::n_hdr_bytes_read, _upk_conn_handle::n_remaining_read, _upk_conn_handle::readbuf, upk_call_received_packet_callbacks(), upk_debug1, upk_deserialize_packet(), upk_disconnect_handle(), upk_error, UPK_MAX_PACKET_SIZE, UPK_MAX_SUPPORTED_PROTO, UPK_MIN_SUPPORTED_PROTO, UPK_PACKET_FOOTER_LEN, UPK_PACKET_HEADER_LEN, and upk_pkt_free().

Referenced by upk_net_event_dispatcher().
